title: Strong zero-divisor graph of p.q.-Baer $*$-rings
authors: Anil Khairnar, Nana Kumbhar, B. N. Waphare
abstract:
In this paper, we study the strong zero-divisor graph of a p.q.-Baer
$*$-ring. We determine the condition on a p.q.-Baer $*$-ring (in terms of the
smallest central projection in a lattice of central projections of a $*$-ring),
so that its strong zero-divisor graph contains a cut vertex. It is proved that
the set of cut vertices of a strong zero-divisor graph of a p.q.-Baer $*$-ring
forms a complete subgraph. We prove that the complement of the strong
zero-divisor graph of a p.q.-Baer $*$-ring is connected if and only if the
$*$-ring contains at least six central projections. We characterize the
diameter and girth of the complement of a strong zero-divisor graph of a
p.q.-Baer $*$-ring. Also, we characterize p.q.-Baer $*$-rings whose strong
zero-divisor graph is complemented.
